newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungarian grains futures firm on hot weather.
newsitem.headline: Hungarian grains futures firm on hot weather.

text.p: Hungary's milling wheat and maize futures rose on Wednesday, mainly on worries caused by the unseasonally hot weather and insufficient, and partly on the export outlook, traders said.

Most milling wheat futures closed higher on the Budapest Commodity Echange, except the October maturity, which finished at 25,350 forints, down 140 forints due to a technical correction, traders said.
They said that other milling wheat futures rose as the hot weather which could worsen crop outlooks, coupled with increasing demand on the spot market, made sellers cautious.
"Probably the weather and a substantial buying interest on the physical market contributed (to the rise)," said Robert Vajo of Termin Broker.
"Traders hope that they can sell the wheat at a good price in August and September," he added.
The price of August milling wheat futures was settled at 24,380 forints, up 280.
The hot weather, and buying interest for smaller amounts from Poland, pushed most maize futures prices up, traders said.
